Description: Rim fragment of a North Ionian black-glazed pottery column-krater. Short neck, flat rim. Fabric, greyish-brown. Slipped. Broken maeander on top of rim, black squares on edge. Languettes below neck. Head of a lion and part of that of a goat; incised. Two incised blobs as filling ornament. Inside neck glazed with red band edged in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Similar to a krater from Old Smryna, J.M. Cook, Annual of the British School at Athens 60 (1965) 121, no. 34, pl. 27
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (pp. 11-2, no. 10, pl. 10, no. 10)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 116, no. 7, pl. 13.G)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.528)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1888.185 (Old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
Miscellaneous number: V.188c (Old Ashmolean Museum vase number)
